DOC.brief_summary: - Comparison study analgesic effect dexmedetomidine-fentanyl vs dexmedetomidine-ketamine - lateral position spinal anesthesia femur proximal fracture patient
DOC.detailed_description: - Dexmedetomidine ( 1mcg/kg ) - fentanyl ( 1mcg/kg ) v dexmedetomidine ( 1mcg/kg ) - ketamine ( 1mg/kg ) 10 minute load . - After 10 minute drug infusion , patient prepare spinal anesthesia . - pain scale quality patient positioning measure three time ( lateral position , chest-knee position , intrathecal local anesthetic injection ) - When patient severe pain intraoperative period , fentanyl 50 mcg intravenously inject . - Patients inject propofol 10mg agitation sign operation . - vital sign , bispectral index , korean version mini mental status examination , verbal rating scale , fentany/propofol consumption , frequency intrathecal injection
DOC.criteria: American society anesthesiologist classification 13 patient > 20 year old patient refuse dementia patient , cooperation difficult patient anaphylaxis dexmedetomidine , ketamine , local anesthetic heart problem ( bradycardia , atrioventricular block )
